svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - February 26 2017

title: "Week in Ethereum News
February 26, 2017" date: "2017-02-26"
News and Links
Top
• Tuesday the 28th sees the launch of the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance NYTimes . Reuters Monax (Eris)
is joining Hyperledger , so there will be an EVM option on IBM’s Hyperledger as well Tyler Smith: Why
the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance will prove private chains are an ally
Tuesday the 28th sees the launch of the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance
• NYTimes . Reuters
• Monax (Eris) is joining Hyperledger , so there will be an EVM option on IBM’s Hyperledger as well
• Tyler Smith: Why the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance will prove private chains are an ally
• The Uber of hedge funds ? Numer.ai issues a token to align incentives. As someone who spent the
last few years messing around with neural nets and reading academic papers, I’ve seen the project
evolve and I love that it is combining my two main interests. Awesome experiment. [Did you overfit
your model? And then the derivative: did you overfit your confidence?] Coverage: whitepaper . Blog
post . Cade Metz at Wired . Laura Shin at Forbes
The Uber of hedge funds ? Numer.ai issues a token to align incentives. As someone who spent the last
few years messing around with neural nets and reading academic papers, I’ve seen the project evolve
and I love that it is combining my two main interests. Awesome experiment. [Did you overfit your
model? And then the derivative: did you overfit your confidence?]
• Coverage: whitepaper . Blog post . Cade Metz at Wired . Laura Shin at Forbes
• Gnosis publishes new state of the art multi-sig contract. Also: over 13% of all Ether are controlled
by just two single keys. [Risk factor!]
Gnosis publishes new state of the art multi-sig contract. Also: over 13% of all Ether are controlled
• Epicenter talks to Vitalik
Epicenter talks to Vitalik
Stuff for Dapp developers
• What is a uPort identity?
• Remix can now import files via swarm
• EthPM (package management) is getting a Foundation
• How to create a Token Factory on Ethereum using Embark
• 0x: An Open Protocol For Decentralized Exchange
Protocol
• Crazy interesting, but made my brain hurt: formally proving correctness on a fundamental piece of
Vitalik’s Casper
• Vitalik’s Intro to Cryptoeconomics talk
• Jeff Wilcke’s Dev diary
• How you can help deploy ENS
Ecosystem
• Status.im’s plan for Ethereum mass adoption still makes the most sense .
• A few new videos from the Foundation
• Consensys stablecoin project VariabL alpha registration is open
• Remember how the testnet was getting mined by GPUs? Now that testnet Ether is being used to spam
the test net
• Ether.camp talks about how HackerGold can be improved . Indeed.
• Comparing and contrasting Digital Asset Management Platforms
• Coinbase’s Linda Xie: A beginner’s guide to Ethereum
Project Updates
• Akasha, v0.5: Seeking Whispers
• Golem: How we’re making progress on Brass release
• Codetract.io has its gold backed token live in beta on public chain
• Metagold Dev update
• Plutus - Progress & Next Steps
• Mysterium VPN - Feb Update
• Slock.it’s charging station with access control on Ethereum is going live in Germany in a few
months.
Token Sales
• Edgeless casino FAQ
Edgeless casino FAQ
• WeTrust: Crowdsale Analyst: Daniel Zakrisson on WeTrust Emin Gün Sirer on why he’s a WeTrust advisor
Blockchannel podcast
WeTrust:
• Crowdsale Analyst: Daniel Zakrisson on WeTrust
• Emin Gün Sirer on why he’s a WeTrust advisor
• Blockchannel podcast
• Mougayar with the obvious historical truth: Just like venture funded companies, 80% of projects with
token sales will fail
Mougayar with the obvious historical truth: Just like venture funded companies, 80% of projects with
General
• “ Business and the blockchain ” conference I’m helping organize at Rice University on April 24.
Remember : private chains aren’t the enemy; they are the gateway drug.
“ Business and the blockchain ” conference I’m helping organize at Rice University on April 24.
• Remember : private chains aren’t the enemy; they are the gateway drug.
• HackerNews discussion of decentralized storage projects
HackerNews discussion of decentralized storage projects
• If you prefer to watch instead of read: Hudson Jameson on the Ethereum roadmap .
If you prefer to watch instead of read: Hudson Jameson on the Ethereum roadmap .
• I continue to enjoy Taylor Gerring’s blockchain vlogs and his sense of humor
I continue to enjoy Taylor Gerring’s blockchain vlogs and his sense of humor
• Ethereum now live on eToro .
Ethereum now live on eToro .
• Brock Pierce’s Blockchain Capital will raise some of their third fund in a token sale
Brock Pierce’s Blockchain Capital will raise some of their third fund in a token sale
• Attempted exhaustive roundup of Ether projects: The Etherian: Edition 3
Attempted exhaustive roundup of Ether projects: The Etherian: Edition 3
• Michael Wuehler: Fortune 500 Ethereum investment probably equal to Ethereum market cap
Michael Wuehler: Fortune 500 Ethereum investment probably equal to Ethereum market cap
• Sensationalist headline: R3 Admits Defeat, Stops Blockchain Development
Sensationalist headline: R3 Admits Defeat, Stops Blockchain Development
• R3 threatens to sue
R3 threatens to sue
• Solid take from Colin Platt: Taxonomy of Distributed Ledgers
Solid take from Colin Platt: Taxonomy of Distributed Ledgers
• If you haven’t changed your passwords yet because of Cloudbleed , it’s rarely a bad idea to update
passwords.
If you haven’t changed your passwords yet because of Cloudbleed , it’s rarely a bad idea to update
• Fred Ehrsam and Philip Rosedale talk VR and blockchains
Fred Ehrsam and Philip Rosedale talk VR and blockchains
Dates of note
• Feb 27 – Intellisys private equity “Mainstreet fund ” sale begins (closed to US/EU citizens, KYC
done by exchange for initial purchase and for dividends)
• Feb 28 – Enterprise Ethereum Alliance launch
• Feb 28 – Edgeless token sale starts (no US)
• Mar 1 – WeTrust token sale begins (1st day bonus, weekly price changes)
• Mar 1 – Qtum sale begins
• Mar 12 - Intellisys price change
• Mar 14 – Ethereum Name Service (ENS) released on public chain
• Mar 24 – Matchpool token sale begins
• Mar 26 – SuperDAO token sale begins
• “Feb/Mar” – iEx.ec token sale begins
• “Feb/Mar” – Gnosis token sale likely to begin
• “March” – Cosmos token sale begins
• April 6 – Humaniq token sale begins
• April 24 – Rice Blockchain for Business conference
• Q2 – Omise GO token sale
[I aim for a relatively comprehensive list of Ethereum sales, but make no warranty as to even whether
they are legit; as such, I thus likewise warrant nothing about whether any will produce a satisfactory
return. I have passed the CFA exams , but this is not investment advice. If you’re interested in what
I do, you can find my Ethereum investing thesis and token sale appreciation strategies in previous
Ethereum news letters.]
Let me know how if dates have changed and I missed them: weekinethereum@gmail.com
The weekly “please share” beg
If you found this useful, please share it. Muito obrigado, senhoras e senhores.
THE BIG ASK : When you share it, please link to weekinethereumnews.com.
Just in case you want to send Ether (or tokens?): 0x96d4F0E75ae86e4c46cD8e9D4AE2F2309bD6Ec45
